{ "id": "welcome-to-my-blog", "title": "Welcome to My Blog: The Beginning of a Tech Journey", "date": "March 4 2025", "author": "DEV_NAME_", "tags": ["Introduction", "Personal", "Development"], "content": "

Welcome to my first blog on my website! Hopefully this'll be the first of many, many blogs that I do, that'll range from software development, to all manners of cybersecurity stuff! I'll try and keep them all fun, informative, and reflective of anything cool I make!


I'll try my best to write a blog twice a month, and hopefully once a week, however quality will be prioritised over quantity, of course. Hopefully you'll enjoy all my blogs, have a look at a few of my projects, and have a tinker at the interactive terminal I've made (which will hopefully have more and more stuff in it over time!)

What to Expect

In the coming weeks and months, I plan to share:


  • Tutorials and walkthroughs of interesting coding problems
  • Cybersecurity insights and discoveries
  • Deep dives into technologies I'm currently exploring
  • Updates on personal projects I'm working on
  • Reflections on my learning journey

About Me

For those who don't know me yet, I'm a developer with a passion for cybersecurity and creating useful, interactive web applications. This portfolio site is both a showcase of my work and a playground where I can experiment with new ideas.


The interactive terminal you might have noticed is one such experiment - it's designed to be both functional and fun, giving you a different way to explore my portfolio. I'll be adding more commands and features to it over time!

Let's Connect

I'm always open to feedback, questions, or just a friendly chat about tech. Don't hesitate to reach out if you find something interesting here or have suggestions for future topics.


Thanks for stopping by, and I hope you'll join me on this journey!


- Iolo

" }

projects.all-sorts.json:
{ "id": "all-sorts", "title": "All-Sorts", "description": "An advanced algorithm visualization platform showcasing 15+ sorting algorithms through real-time, interactive visualizations.", "date": "2024-08-15", "tags": ["React", "TypeScript", "Tailwind CSS", "Algorithms", "Interactive"], "github": "https://github.com/ioloEJ42/All-Sorts", "live": "https://all-sorts.netlify.app/", "content": "

Project Overview

All-Sorts is a modern, interactive sorting algorithm visualization platform that brings complex computer science concepts to life. The application allows users to visualize 15+ sorting algorithms in real-time, with customizable array sizes and sorting speeds, making it an excellent educational tool for understanding algorithm efficiency and behavior.

Algorithm Categories

Logarithmic (O(n log n))

  • Quick Sort
  • Merge Sort
  • Heap Sort

Quadratic (O(n²))

  • Bubble Sort
  • Selection Sort
  • Insertion Sort
  • Shell Sort
  • Comb Sort
  • Brick Sort
  • Cocktail Sort
  • Pancake Sort
  • Gnome Sort

Unique & Experimental

  • Bitonic Sort (requires power-of-2 arrays)
  • Bogo Sort
  • Radix Sort
  • Stooge Sort

Technical Features

  • Real-time Visualization Engine: Watch algorithms work step-by-step with visual feedback
  • Interactive Controls: Adjust array size (5-200 elements) and sorting speed
  • Abort Control System: Stop sorting operations at any time
  • Visual State Indicators: Color-coded elements showing comparison, sorting, and completion states
  • Responsive Design: Works seamlessly across device sizes
  • Smooth Transitions: Page transitions and UI animations enhance user experience

Technical Implementation

The project is built with a modern web technology stack:

  • React 18 with TypeScript: For a robust, type-safe component architecture
  • Tailwind CSS: Utility-first CSS framework for styling
  • Framer Motion: For smooth animations and transitions
  • React Router: For application navigation
  • React Hot Toast: For user notifications
  • Vite: For fast development and optimized builds

Architecture

The application follows a modular architecture with clear separation of concerns:

  • Algorithms Module: Pure TypeScript implementations of sorting algorithms
  • Visualization Engine: React components that render and animate the sorting process
  • Control System: Interactive UI elements for controlling the visualization
  • Type System: Comprehensive TypeScript definitions ensuring code reliability

Educational Value

All-Sorts serves as both a practical tool and an educational resource:

  • Visualizes algorithm behavior in real-time
  • Illustrates time complexity differences between algorithm categories
  • Provides algorithm descriptions and complexity information
  • Allows direct comparison between different sorting approaches

This project demonstrates my ability to implement complex algorithms, create interactive visualizations, and build educational tools using modern web technologies. It also showcases my understanding of computer science fundamentals and UI/UX design principles.

" }
projects.ascii-art-generator.json:
{ "id": "ascii-art-generator", "title": "ASCII Art Generator", "description": "An interactive web application for creating, customizing, and exporting ASCII art with multiple shapes, patterns, and export options.", "date": "2024-09-20", "tags": ["React", "TypeScript", "Tailwind CSS", "Vite", "Interactive"], "github": "https://github.com/ioloEJ42/ASCII-GEN", "live": "https://ascii-gen.netlify.app/", "content": "

Project Overview

The ASCII Art Generator is a short little project compromising of a web application that allows users to create, customize, and export ASCII art.

Key Features

  • Dynamic Shape Generation: Choose from multiple shapes including circle, square, triangle, heart, octagon, star, and diamond
  • Customizable Patterns: Apply various patterns to your shapes, including animated options like wave, spiral, and pulsate
  • Real-time Color Management: Customize background, main, and accent colors with an intuitive color picker
  • Interactive Resizing: Resize your ASCII art in real-time with a draggable interface
  • Multiple Export Options: Save your creation as JPG, PNG, animated GIF, or even as a React component
  • Responsive Design: Fully responsive layout that works on desktop and mobile devices
  • Dark Mode: Toggle between light and dark themes for comfortable viewing
  • Keyboard Shortcuts: Enhance productivity with easy-to-use keyboard shortcuts

Technical Implementation

The project leverages several modern web technologies:

  • React.js with TypeScript: For a robust, type-safe component architecture
  • Vite: Next-generation front-end tooling for faster development and optimized builds
  • Tailwind CSS: Utility-first CSS framework for rapid UI development
  • Shadcn UI: Re-usable components built with Radix UI and Tailwind CSS
  • HTML2Canvas: For rendering and capturing the ASCII art as an image
  • GIF.js: Enables the creation of animated GIFs from the ASCII art

Performance Considerations

The application includes several performance optimizations:

  • Efficient re-rendering using React's useCallback and useMemo hooks
  • Optimized art generation algorithm to handle large ASCII art sizes
  • Lazy loading of export functionalities to reduce initial load time

User Experience

The application provides an intuitive interface with:

  • Separate tabs for shape selection, pattern customization, and color management
  • Real-time preview of changes
  • Convenient keyboard shortcuts for common actions
  • Multiple export options to suit different needs
  • Responsive design that works across devices

Accessibility

Accessibility was a key consideration, with features like:

  • Proper ARIA labels on interactive elements
  • Keyboard navigation support
  • Color contrast considerations in the UI design
  • Screen reader-friendly content structure

This project demonstrates my ability to create complex, interactive web applications with a focus on user experience, performance, and accessibility.

" }
projects.file-integrity-monitor.json:
{ "id": "file-integrity-monitor", "title": "File Integrity Monitor", "description": "A Python-based security tool for real-time file system monitoring with cryptographic verification and comprehensive reporting.", "date": "2024-10-15", "tags": ["Python", "Security", "Watchdog", "SQLite", "PDF Reporting"], "github": "https://github.com/ioloEJ42/File_Integrity_Monitor", "live": "N/A", "content": "

Project Overview

File Integrity Monitor (FIM) is a robust Python-based security tool that provides real-time monitoring and integrity verification of files within specified directories. The tool tracks file system events including creation, modification, deletion, and renaming, while maintaining detailed logs with user attribution and cryptographic hashes.

Key Features

  • Real-time Monitoring: Detects and records file system events as they happen
  • Cryptographic Verification: Uses SHA-256 hashing to detect unauthorized content changes
  • User Attribution: Tracks which user performed each file operation
  • Cross-Platform Support: Works on Windows, Unix, and WSL with path normalization
  • Database Integration: Maintains event history in SQLite database
  • Advanced Reporting: Exports detailed logs in CSV and PDF formats with visualizations
  • Interactive Interface: Color-coded terminal output for different event types

Technical Implementation

The project uses several key technologies and libraries:

  • Watchdog: For efficient event-based file system monitoring
  • SQLite: For persistent storage of file hashes and event logs
  • Reportlab: For generating comprehensive PDF reports with analytics
  • Rich: For enhanced terminal output and user experience

Security Considerations

File integrity monitoring is a crucial aspect of cybersecurity, especially for systems that require high levels of compliance. This tool helps detect unauthorized changes to important files by:

  • Creating a baseline of known-good hashes
  • Continuously monitoring for changes to files
  • Alerting when unexpected modifications occur
  • Providing forensic evidence of file system activities

Architecture

The project is structured with separation of concerns in mind:

  • Core Monitoring: Main file handling event detection and processing
  • Database Layer: Data persistence and retrieval
  • Export Module: Reporting capabilities with visualizations
  • Test Framework: Automated testing of monitoring capabilities

This modular approach allows for easy extension of functionality and makes the codebase maintainable.

" }
projects.minimal-dashboard.json:
{ "id": "minimal-dashboard", "title": "Minimal Dashboard", "description": "A custom browser homepage with search functionality, organized links, and integrated Linux command references.", "date": "2025-01-05", "tags": ["HTML", "CSS", "JavaScript"], "github": "https://github.com/ioloEJ42/ioloEJ42.github.io", "live": "https://ioloej42.github.io/", "content": "

A clean, efficient browser homepage I built to replace the default new tab page. Designed with speed and simplicity in mind while including the features I personally needed.

Features

  • Multi-engine search functionality (DuckDuckGo, Google, Bing)
  • Organized link categories for quick access to frequently used sites
  • Real-time clock display
  • Built-in reference sheets for Linux commands (i3WM, tmux, nano)
  • Minimal design with dot grid background

Why I Built It

I created this dashboard to have complete control over my browsing experience. My motivations included:

  • Having quick access to Linux documentation and resources
  • Creating an easily accessible reference for command shortcuts
  • Implementing a cleaner, darker aesthetic I prefer
  • Building something lightweight with zero dependencies
  • Having full ownership of the code rather than relying on extensions

Implementation

Built with vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript - no frameworks, no build tools, no overhead. The entire dashboard loads instantly and runs entirely in the browser.

" }
projects.password-strength-analyser.json:
{ "id": "password-strength-analyser", "title": "Password Strength Analyser", "description": "A real-time password strength assessment tool with visual indicators, pattern detection, and custom recommendations.", "date": "2025-03-01", "tags": ["HTML", "CSS", "JavaScript", "Security", "Frontend"], "github": "https://github.com/ioloEJ42/Password-strength-checker", "live": "https://pwd-checker.netlify.app/", "content": "

Project Overview

In my honest opinion, a password strength checker is just the security equivalent of \"Hello World\", so consider this an obligatory entry project.

This analyser provides real-time feedback on password strength without any unnecessary complexity or feature bloat. Just pure, straightforward password analysis.

Key Features

  • Real-time Analysis: Immediate feedback as you type
  • Visual Strength Meter: Color-coded segments showing password strength from 0-100
  • Basic Requirements Checking: Length, uppercase, lowercase, numbers, special characters
  • Advanced Pattern Detection: Identifies common passwords, repeated characters, sequential patterns, and personal information
  • Terminal-style Recommendations: Custom, actionable advice to improve password security
  • Clean, Responsive UI: Works on all devices without unnecessary visual clutter

Technical Implementation

Built with vanilla web technologies to demonstrate core fundamentals:


  • HTML5: Semantic structure for the analyser interface
  • CSS3: Custom styling for visual indicators and responsive design
  • Vanilla JavaScript: No frameworks or libraries - just clean, efficient code

Security Aspects

The analyser implements several key security principles:


  • Password complexity assessment using multiple criteria
  • Common password database comparison
  • Pattern recognition algorithms to detect weak security patterns
  • Security-focused UI with password visibility toggle

While it's a simple project, it demonstrates fundamental security concepts that form the foundation of more complex security applications. Sometimes the most important security tools are the ones that help users create better passwords in the first place.

" }
projects.steganography-dissertation.json:
{ "id": "steganography-dissertation", "title": "Undergraduate Dissertation: Integrative Approaches to Digital Steganography", "description": "A comprehensive educational platform exploring seven steganography techniques with LSB implementation, a recommendation system, and quality assessment tools.", "date": "2024-05-01", "tags": ["Python", "React", "Tailwind CSS", "Steganography", "Cybersecurity", "Educational"], "github": "https://github.com/ioloEJ42/UnderGraduate_Dissertation", "live": "N/A", "content": "

This dissertation provides a comprehensive examination of steganography, with a specific focus on the development of innovative scripts, tools, and educational resources designed to enhance the application and understanding of steganography in digital communication.

Key Achievements

  • Developed a fully functional LSB steganography script capable of embedding text and binary data in images
  • Created a PSNR and MSE calculation tool for quantitative steganographic quality assessment
  • Designed a recommendation system to guide users in selecting appropriate steganography techniques
  • Built comprehensive educational modules covering seven steganography techniques
  • Implemented a prototype framework for future steganographic implementations

Steganography Techniques Explored

The platform provides educational content on seven key steganography techniques:

  • Least Significant Bit (LSB)
  • Discrete Cosine Transform (DCT)
  • Discrete Wavelet Transform (DWT)
  • Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT)
  • Bit-Plane Complexity Segmentation (BPCS)
  • Palette-Based Steganography
  • Fractal Steganography

Technical Implementation

The project was implemented using multiple technologies:

  • Python with OpenCV and NumPy for the LSB steganography script and quality assessment tools
  • React with Tailwind CSS for the educational web platform
  • Material-UI for interactive components and tabbed interfaces
  • Modular architecture to facilitate future expansions

Novel Contributions

The dissertation introduces several novel elements to the field:


  • Integration of a recommendation system for method selection based on user requirements
  • Evaluation of embedding quality using advanced metrics (NMSE, PSNR)
  • A comprehensive framework for future steganography implementations
  • Educational modules with interactive elements and pseudocode examples

The project successfully bridges the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical application in steganography, making complex concepts accessible to students, researchers, and cybersecurity professionals.

" }
